name: Mała pętla Bieszczadzka
description: Mała pętla Bieszczadzka is a shorter variant of the famous loop road in the Bieszczady mountains. The loop takes us around the Solina lake, giving us a good taste of mountainous terrain we can expect on the bigger loop.

point_of_interests.name: LOTOS fuel
point_of_interests.description: It is advised to tank here before departing. Gas stations in more remote areas might have fuel of questionable quality

point_of_interests.name: Korbania
point_of_interests.description: Small detour to a 1 hour each way hike to one of the best vistas in the area. There is a wooden tower on the summit that provides a great view of the surrounding area.

point_of_interests.name: Czatownia bistro
point_of_interests.description: The only restaurant on this side of the loop, although you might find food in hotels, which there is plenty of along the way.

point_of_interests.name: Mountain bends
point_of_interests.description: Two 180 degree turns that might pose some challenge to inexperienced motorcyclists.

point_of_interests.name: Abandoned orthodox church
point_of_interests.description: Abandoned building - Cerkiew parafialna pw Przemienienia Pańskiego

name: Duża pętla Bieszczadzka
description: Duża pętla Bieszczadzka is a longer variant of the famous loop road in the Bieszczady mountains. Constant hikes and descends, fantastic turns and beautiful scenery place it in the 'must ride' category of Polish motorcycle routes. The bigger loop also takes us deeper into the mountains and forests of the Bieszczady national park.

point_of_interests.name: LOTOS fuel
point_of_interests.description: It is advised to tank here before departing. Gas stations in more remote areas might have fuel of questionable quality.

point_of_interests.name: Przystanek Smerek
point_of_interests.description: Fantastic local food.

point_of_interests.name: Mountain turns
point_of_interests.description: A couple big turns that might cause problems if the road is wet

point_of_interests.name: Mountain turns with a view
point_of_interests.description: Beautiful scenery as you descend down a hill

point_of_interests.name: Hike to IWW mass graves
point_of_interests.description: Nice hike on lesser known trails of Bieszczady

name: Jeziorsko
description: A ride around the Jeziorsko artificial lake. Not very overwhelming. It is very uniqie to go there after September ends, as the lake is being drained of water from the winter. If you own a dirt bike you can try riding on the lake bed.

point_of_interests.name: Restaurants in the area
point_of_interests.description: This area has a couple nice restaurants, some of them with a view of the lake

point_of_interests.name: Water recreation
point_of_interests.description: Many recreation centers in the area can offer kayaks, jet-skis and more

point_of_interests.name: Marina and beach
point_of_interests.description: Nice marina for sailing yachts, especially stunning when the lake is drained.

point_of_interests.name: Jeziorsko Dam
point_of_interests.description: View of the whole reservoir from the dam.

name: Grotniki and Bełdów
description: Short route right outside the city of Łódź, trough the beautiful Grotniki forest. Rather undemanding route that takes you through towns, forests and villages.

point_of_interests.name: Zalew nad Lindą
point_of_interests.description: Small lake on the river Linda. A couple nice beach bars and restaurants in the area.

point_of_interests.name: Viaduct
point_of_interests.description: A viaduct over the highway gives a surprisingly good overview of the surrounding area

point_of_interests.name: Viaduct 2
point_of_interests.description: Another viaduct gives us a possibility to look over the area again.

point_of_interests.name: Old vehicle cemetery
point_of_interests.description: A lot of abandoned cars and trucks from the communist times can be found here.

name: Bełchatów coal mine
description: This route takes you in the area of one of the biggest coal mines of Poland, as well as surrounding forests and villages. The view of the coal mine is astounding making it one of the most frequented routes in the area of Łódź

point_of_interests.name: View of the coal mine
point_of_interests.description: One of the points where it is possible to get an overview of the mine

point_of_interests.name: Coal mine observation deck
point_of_interests.description: Coal mine observation deck

point_of_interests.name: WWII plane replica
point_of_interests.description: During WWII a Polish plane crashed in this forest. The wreck has been removed but the event is commemorated by a replica of the plane.

point_of_interests.name: ORLEN gas station
point_of_interests.description: Gas station, one of the very few in the area.

name: Častolovice castle
description: This route takes us through the Polish-Czech border in the Sudety mountains. The route takes us to Častolovice and back. Crossing the border does not require a passport control, but it's important to remember that the Czechs are more serious about speed limit control.

point_of_interests.name: Častolovice castle
point_of_interests.description: Originally built in the 13th century the castle was rebuild to fit the renaissance style in the 16th century.

point_of_interests.name: Narrow roads with a lot of turns
point_of_interests.description: Narrow roads with sharp turns high in the mountains

name: Kudowa-Zdrój - Walim
description: The route starts in Kudowa-Zdrój and continues through the Góry Stołowe national park along the road known to motorcyclists as the "route of a hundred turns". The route terminates in Walim where a lot of WWII German fortifications can be found.

point_of_interests.name: Riese fortifications
point_of_interests.description: The whole area is full of post-nazi bunkers, tunnels and trenches.

point_of_interests.name: Route of the hundred turns
point_of_interests.description: This part of the route is known to Polish motorcyclists as the route of a hundred turns.

point_of_interests.name: Sczeliniec
point_of_interests.description: Summit of the Szczeliniec mountain provides a view of the area.

point_of_interests.name: Gas stations
point_of_interests.description: The only gas stations along this route (except for beginning and end) are in Nowa Ruda.

name: Loop around Tatry
description: This route encircles all of Polish part of the Tatry mountains. The loop goes through Slovakia, but no passport control is necessary.

point_of_interests.name: Dobczyce castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle on a hill

point_of_interests.name: Gas stations
point_of_interests.description: It is a good idea to tank in Poprad as there are no gas stations in the mountain passes

point_of_interests.name: Mountain road
point_of_interests.description: Road high in the mountains might be dangerous depending on the weather.

point_of_interests.name: Czostrzyn castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle ruins with picturesque view of the river valley

point_of_interests.name: Krywan
point_of_interests.description: A vista of the Krywań mountain, one of the most famous mountains of Slovakia

name: Castles of Jura Krakowsko-Częstocho
description: This route goes right through Jura Krakowsko Częstochowska visiting many castles along the way. This region is known for beautiful caves and rock formations.

point_of_interests.name: Smoleń castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle now in ruin

point_of_interests.name: Zegarowe skały
point_of_interests.description: Interesting rock formations

point_of_interests.name: Podzamcze castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle pretty run down

point_of_interests.name: Bobolice castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle pretty run down

point_of_interests.name: Ostrężnik Castle
point_of_interests.description: Medieval castle pretty run down

point_of_interests.name: Raczyński Palace
point_of_interests.description: Raczyński Palace from XIX century

name: Krakow - Zakopane loop
description: Loop that takes you from the former capital of Poland to one of its mot famous tourist retreats in the tallest mountains of Poland and back to Kraków again.

point_of_interests.name: Łapszanka mountain pass
point_of_interests.description: Great view of the tatry mountains

point_of_interests.name: Niedzica Castle
point_of_interests.description: One on the most beautiful castles in Poland, right above a lake

point_of_interests.name: Curvy mountain roads
point_of_interests.description: Some turns that might be dangerous depending on the weather

name: Nothern Mazury lakes
description: This route goes around the northern Mazury lakes. Not all roads are paved here. WWII Wolfenstein bunkers can be visited with a small detour.

point_of_interests.name: Wolfenstein bunkers
point_of_interests.description: A complex of Nazi shelters.

point_of_interests.name: Giżycko quay
point_of_interests.description: A view of the lake Niegocin

point_of_interests.name: Hochwald bunkers
point_of_interests.description: More post WWII bunkers

name: Bytów - Mikorowo loop
description: This route does a loop in hilly forests of Kashubia.

point_of_interests.name: Bytów
point_of_interests.description: It's best to tank before departing.

point_of_interests.name: Mikorowo church
point_of_interests.description: Beautiful Church. still in use

point_of_interests.name: Karwno lake
point_of_interests.description: beautiful view of the Karwno lake

name: South Bydgoszcz Loop
description: Loop that takes you through forests surrounding Bydgoszcz, through a post-nazi weapons factory

point_of_interests.name: Beach on lake Jezuickie
point_of_interests.description: Wild beach in a forest

point_of_interests.name: DAG factory
point_of_interests.description: Ruins of a second biggest Nazi weapons factory.

name: West Bydgoszcz loop
description: Loop that takes you through the beautiful country side west of Bydgoszcz.

point_of_interests.name: Sluice
point_of_interests.description: Sluice over a small river. An uncommon view in Poland.

point_of_interests.name: Beautiful views
point_of_interests.description: This area is full of beautiful views

point_of_interests.name: Abandoned Slaughterhouse
point_of_interests.description: Abandoned building that used to be a slaughterhouse.

name: Stargard Sczeciśnki east loop
description: Loop that takes you around a national park. A small detour will take you to ruins of a castle built by a Maltese knight order.

point_of_interests.name: Castle ruins
point_of_interests.description: Maltese knights were brought here by the Germans and have built a castle

point_of_interests.name: Castle restaurant
point_of_interests.description: There is a restaurant in the ruins of the castle

point_of_interests.name: Military exercises
point_of_interests.description: This area of the forest is used by the military. Do not enter.

name: Łagów - Sulinowo
description: Route across western Poland, that goes past the largest statue of Jesus in the world.

point_of_interests.name: Military exercise
point_of_interests.description: This area is used by the military. Do not enter.

point_of_interests.name: The statue of Jesus King of Poland
point_of_interests.description: The largest statue of Jesus in the world.

point_of_interests.name: Military airfield
point_of_interests.description: Military exercises in the area

name: Śniardwy lake Loop
description: Loop around the largest lake in Poland. Some roads are not paved and quite steep, so an adventure bike is recommended for this route.

point_of_interests.name: Mikołajki
point_of_interests.description: Mikołajki is the largest town around so it is wise to tank there

point_of_interests.name: Abandoned lumber mill
point_of_interests.description: Abandoned lumber mill

point_of_interests.name: View of the lake
point_of_interests.description: View over the largest of Polish lakes

name: Pruszków - Żelechów
description: Nice short route South of Warsaw.

point_of_interests.name: High traffic
point_of_interests.description: Very high traffic during rush hours

point_of_interests.name: Żelechów Hill
point_of_interests.description: This area is on a small hill that provides overview of the area

point_of_interests.name: Abandoned post-industrial
point_of_interests.description: Abandoned post-industrial building with access to the roof

name: Bilgoraj - Kraśnik
description: Short route through Janowskie forests and villages.

point_of_interests.name: Janowskie forests
point_of_interests.description: The road is surrounded by beautiful forests

point_of_interests.name: Polish Holywood
point_of_interests.description: "Holywood" letters in the middle of a forest. Nobody knows why it's there.

point_of_interests.name: Dangerous turn
point_of_interests.description: Sharp turn with a railroad crossing

name: East Białystok loop
description: Short loop east of Białystok in the Knyszyn national forest.

point_of_interests.name: Supraśl gas station
point_of_interests.description: Supraśl is the last town before entering the woods

point_of_interests.name: Mass grave of insurgents
point_of_interests.description: Insurgents against the russian empire in the XIX century were buried here.

point_of_interests.name: Abandoned tannery
point_of_interests.description: This building used to be a tannery

name: Big Podlasie loop
description: Loop around Białystok and the surrounding region of podlasie. The route is a mixture of deep forests and small towns and villages

point_of_interests.name: Gas station
point_of_interests.description: Last gas station before the woods

point_of_interests.name: Mass graves
point_of_interests.description: Mass graves of insurgents against the Russian empire

point_of_interests.name: Beach on Siemianówka lake
point_of_interests.description: Beach with a view across the lake
